CatDescriptText: Vi Jones, elevator operator, East End and Steve Ungauri, stockboy, Bridgeville, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, October 29, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think there is too much emphasis placed on sports in high school and college?"  Mrs. Jones's answer reads: "Sports are essential if accompanied with a good scholastic standing.  It's very nice to have students participating in sports in high school and college to aid in bringing prestige to the school...But it's good only as long as scholastic standings are maintained."  Mr. Ungauri's answer reads: "No, I don't think so"
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Steve Ungauri wearing textured zippered jacket, standing in front of store window, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Vi Jones wearing light colored knitted cardigan, standing in profile in front of C.A. Michel's, Smithfield Street, Downtown
